newsitem.title: LEBANON: Arab Fund to lend Lebanon $20 million for highway.
newsitem.headline: Arab Fund to lend Lebanon $20 million for highway.

text.p: The Kuwait-based Arab Fund initialled an agreement with the Lebanese government on Wednesday to lend six million Kuwaiti dinars ($20 million) to help finance a coastal highway project in Beirut.
The Council for Development and Reconstruction (CDR) said in a statement the loan represented 45 percent of the total cost of the project.
The 22-year loan carries 4.5 percent annual interest and includes a five-year grace period, CDR added.

In October, the Kuwaiti Development Fund initialled an agreement to lend Lebanon six million dinars to help fund the project, a five-km (three-mile) highway linking Beirut port and Nahr al-Mawt river.
The Lebanese government will cover the remaining 10 percent of the cost.
